Recipe.Title: Pinapple Chicken Kabobs
Recipe.RecipeIntroduction: For people who love chicken, pineapple, and pepper.

ToolTip.Text: Use a high-heat cooking oil, such as Canola oil, olive oil or peanut oil
TODO: THIS WILL BE FOR PREHEAT IN STEP cook 1. Preheating means to heat up an oven, grill, or similar appliance before cooking something.
TODO: THIS WILL BE FOR MEDIUM HIGH HEAT IN STEP cook 1.

TODO: THIS WILL BE FOR OIL THE GRILL IN STEP Cook 1. Dip a paper towel into the cooking oil without saturating it. You want to coat the grate, but do not want the oil dripping. Make sure to use an oven mitt and tongs to run the paper towl over the grate!

RecipeStep.StepText: Chop up the green bell pepper into 1-inch pieces
RecipeStep.Title: Chop green pepper

RecipeStep.StepText: Chop up half of an onion into 1-inch pieces
RecipeStep.Title: Chop onion into slices

RecipeStep.StepText: Chop the chicken breast into 1-inch chunks
RecipeStep.Title: Chop chicken breast into chunks

RecipeStep.Warning: Make sure not to get too close to the heated grill! Use an oven mitt and tongs when oiling the grill
RecipeStep.StepText: Preheat an outdoor grill for medium-high heat and lightly oil the grate.
RecipeStep.Title: Heat and oil grill

RecipeStep.StepText: Thread green bell pepper, onion, chicken, and pineapple onto skewers; brush with barbeque sauce.
RecipeStep.Title: Thread Skewers, add barbeque sauce

RecipeStep.StepText: Cook on the preheated grill until chicken is no longer pink in the center and the juices run clear, 7 to 10 minutes per side.
RecipeStep.Title: Cook skewers on grill
